page.title: 01PANTON A GENERAL REVIEW
page.content: {PANTON}is a predominantly rural area with 3O dwellings. 23 are occupied and 7 are unoccupied. Seven of these are farmhouses, ll of the thirty, a third, are not connected with agriculture as a living. There are 47 adults and 23 children. Not one of the adults grew up here as a child. The gently undulating terrain is interspersed with coverts, small woods, and forestry commission plantations covering about 8% of the area. Narrow lanes interweave the scattered houses. An important but not obvious feature is{PANTON BECK}which rises from springs and flows eventually into the Witham. In Wragby,{PANTON}is thought of as being "out there". In London or even in Lincoln, it is regarded as being the "back of beyond" but it is paradoxically seen as a very peaceful rural retreat.
